status.name: In Progress

fields.description:
Fedora is updating wss4j (and xml-security) for OpenSAML 2.x compatibility, and this will break Eucalyptus.  I attempted to compile against the new versions and ran into several problems.

Upgrade notes for WSS4J 1.5 to 1.6:
http://ws.apache.org/wss4j/wss4j16.html#Upgrade_notes

comments.body: Linking to the issue in 1.6.2 which resulted in the removal of EnvelopeIdResolver.
Linking to the commit diff for WSS-301
Attached a dirty patch to add support for wss4j 1.6.7. This stuff needs heavy cleanups. Please note the commented lines.

Here is the error when attempting to build 3.1.2 with newer xml-security and wss4j without Marek's patch:

{noformat}

I've confirmed that [~goldmann]'s patch does allow the build to succeed.  I will do some smoke testing on Fedora 18 to see whether the cloud is functional.

[~goldmann], I have done some testing on this.  I think that it's necessary now to call WSSConfig.getNewInstance once, and store that in a static member of the WSSecurity class.  I changed that, and it got me a little further, but I'm still seeing issues with the CLC and CC communicating due to signature verification failures, so I think the new signature calculation process is not quite right.  I am trying to figure it out.

[~agrimm], let me know if I can help you somehow with it. Once again, this blocks the next jboss-as update in Fedora which adds new great features (webservices and Hibernate 4 support). Thank you very much for looking into it!
I have a patch for this in Fedora, and I'll file a pull request.
